title: For Sale:  Scope with long eye relief, Mosin nagant Mount and scope rings.
postcontent:
This is a scope mount for the Mosin Nagant 91/30, (designed only for the 91/30) and is CNC machined from solid 6061 aluminum bar stock then anodized with a matte black type II finish. I designed this mount to replace the rear sight assembly, and it has a tapered dovetail that matches the tapered mount on the barrel and 10-32 set screws to lock it to the barrel once it is installed. Installation only requires the removal of the rear sight base, then replace with this mount and tighten the set screws. I machine these to be tight on the barrel mount, and more than likely it will require a small block of wood placed on the front of the sight and a couple of taps with a hammer on the wood to drive it home into its final position. Some of the sight bases on the 91/30 are silver soldered on, and if you have one of these the solder left on the barrel mount will need to be filed off before installing this mount. The rifle in the pictures had the base soldered on, and it only took a couple of minutes with a flat file to get the solder off. If you want to see how to get the original sight base off do a search on You Tube and you will find the info you need.

 This mount attaches securely to the dovetail that is on the barrel under the rear sight base, and does not rely on 2 tiny screws through oversized holes in the mount or the "Teeter Totter" designs that utilize one small pin through the rear leaf mount that must take all the force of the recoil. This mount has almost 3" of positive contact on each side of the mounting rail for a total of almost 6" of secure mounting contact, along with 3 set screw locations that tighten against the top of the dovetail rail for even more holding power. Once installed this mount has a clean "Factory" look with smooth sides and no screws and bolts sticking out of the sides. I designed this mount and machine them "In House" in the USA on CNC equipment so I can control the quality, and nothing leaves the shop that I would not install on my own rifles.

This mount also has a machined rear sight built in so you can still use the iron sights along with the scope. If you look at the pictures close you can see a channel machined into the top of the mount and the rear "U" sight machined in the back. The rear sight is not adjustable and it is set the same as the lowest setting on the original sight base, which is 100 meters, or roughly 100 yards. One of the pictures shows looking through the iron sights, but the camera only focused on the rear and the front sight is hard to see and fuzzy in the photo but it lets you see how it looks. The scope base is a Weaver style with 8 mounting locations so you can use your own rings and adjust the position to where you desire. If you have a bent bolt you can shift the scope back farther or keep it forward with the standard straight bolt. This mount requires a long eye relief scope since it is mounted forward of the receiver. Since the rings are not machined in you can use whatever scope and ring (Weaver Ring) combination you choose, and if you ever want to change scopes you do not need to worry if it will fit the mount. With the scope forward on the mount you can still use stripper clips to load instead of loading single rounds as required with a full length scope mount, and you won't have the extra expense of having to get your bolt turned down like with a full length mount.
This scope mount simply replaces the rear sight base and mounts on the dovetail on the barrel, and installation instructions are included. This mount will not work on the M38, M44 or T53 carbines.
